title: 112_hr2008
content: The Act titled "Keeping Politics Out of Federal Contracting Act of 2011" prohibits certain uses of political information. The "Keeping Politics Out of Federal Contracting Act of 2011" prohibits executive agencies from requiring contractors to submit political information related to themselves or any partners, officers, directors, or employees during the procurement process or contract performance. The "Keeping Politics Out of Federal Contracting Act of 2011" prohibits the use of political information in the source selection process for awarding contracts or making decisions related to contract modifications. Executive agencies are also prohibited from including political information in contracting databases, except under certain circumstances. The "Keeping Politics Out of Federal Contracting Act of 2011" prohibits the use of political information in the source selection process for awarding contracts. Data required before the enactment of the Act are exempt from this prohibition. The Act applies to the procurement of commercial items. The "Keeping Politics Out of Federal Contracting Act of 2011" prohibits the use of political information in the source selection process for awarding contracts, including the procurement of commercial items, commercial off-the-shelf items, and non-commercial procurement of supplies, property, services, and manufactured items under various contract vehicles. It does not waive or limit the application of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 or prevent federal regulatory agencies from collecting authorized information. The term 'contractor' includes contractors, bidders, offerors, individuals, and legal entities expected to submit offers for Federal Government contracts. The term 'executive agency' is defined in section 133 of this title. 'Political information' refers to political spending, such as contributions, expenditures, or disbursements made by the contractor or its affiliates to support a candidate for Federal office. The curr_chunk discusses contributions made to political entities for election purposes, as defined by the Federal Campaign Act of 1971. It also includes a clerical amendment to the table of sections in title 41 of the United States Code. The curr_chunk discusses the prohibition on certain uses of political information.
